greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of linear chord diagrams on 2n vertices with one marked chord such that exactly k of the remaining n-1 chords contain the marked chord.
link: Donovan Young, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..9870
Donovan Young, A critical quartet for queuing couples, arXiv:2007.13868 [math.CO], 2020.
example: For n = 2 and k = 1, let the four vertices be {1,2,3,4}. The marked chord can only be (2,3) and it is contained by one other chord, namely (1,4), hence T(2,1) = 1.
xref: Row sums are n*A001147(n) for n > 0.
Leading diagonal is A000142(n-1) for n > 0.
Sub-leading diagonal is A001344(n-2) for n > 1.
results.author: _Donovan Young_, Jul 30 2020
